New Records: Rachin Ravindra became the youngest New Zealand player to score a century in a World Cup match
Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra and Devon Conway put together a stunning stand to smash England's attack
Sam Curran struck with his first ball to dismiss Will Young for a duck in NZ's chase
Pre-Game Insights: No Williamson, Southee, Ferguson, or Bracewell for New Zealand
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed disappointment over England's performance and called it a tough defeat
Tom Latham praised the team's adaptation to the conditions and the performance of Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra
Miscellaneous Highlights: England limited to 282 for 9, thanks in no small part to Mitch Santner and Matt Henry
Others: Rachin Ravindra was named Player of the Match
